liberate.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to free someone from feelings or conditions that make their life unhappy or difficult
liberate.translation[0].definitions[0].e: women’s freedom to pursue careers liberated from childcare
liberate.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to free prisoners, a city, a country etc from someone’s control
liberate.translation[0].definitions[1].e: A few days later, our armies liberated the city.
